Make contingency table with chi-square test of independence

Source: R/tables.R
apa_chisq.Rd

Make contingency table with chi-square test of independence

Usage

apa_chisq(
  x,
  note = NULL,
  font_family = NULL,
  font_size = 12,
  text_color = "black",
  line_spacing = 2,
  border_color = "black",
  border_width = 0.5,
  suppress_warnings = TRUE
)

Arguments

x

A two-column data.frame or tibble

note

Custom note (overrides automatic note.)

font_family

font family

font_size

font size

text_color

text color

line_spacing

spacing between lines

border_color

border color

border_width

border width in pixels

suppress_warnings

Suppress any warnings if true.

Value

flextable

Examples

apa_chisq(mtcars[, c("am", "gear")])
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'ftExtra':
#>   method                  from     
#>   as_flextable.data.frame flextable

am
gear
0
1
n
%
n
%
3
15
78.9%
0
0.0%
4
4
21.1%
8
61.5%
5
0
0.0%
5
38.5%
Note. χ2 (2) = 20.94, p < .001, Adj. Cramer’s V = .78
